title: How to Make Garlic Vodka

steps.headline: Place the peeled cloves into the mason jar.
Fill the mason jar with vodka.
Place the jar in a cool, dark place to infuse.
steps.description: Garlic is a strong flavor, so a few days will be sufficient (3-4 days).

steps.headline: Strain the vodka through a strainer, coffee filter or muslin cloth.
steps.description: Discard the cloves. Return the infused vodka to a suitable serving bottle.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: This is an unusual flavor but luckily for the ghouls and ghosts at Halloween time, it goes superbly well with tomato juice for a garlicky Bloody Mary (known by some as a "Bloody Maria"). Just ideal for the Halloween season!

text: Peel the garlic cloves.  Place the peeled cloves into the mason jar.  Fill the mason jar with vodka.  Screw on the lid. Shake vigorously for a bit. Place the jar in a cool, dark place to infuse. Garlic is a strong flavor, so a few days will be sufficient (3-4 days). Strain the vodka through a strainer, coffee filter or muslin cloth. Discard the cloves. Return the infused vodka to a suitable serving bottle. Serve. This is an unusual flavor but luckily for the ghouls and ghosts at Halloween time, it goes superbly well with tomato juice for a garlicky Bloody Mary (known by some as a "Bloody Maria"). Just ideal for the Halloween season!
